TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit GetSharingMetadataType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseRequestType

Docs.summary: The class represents a request to get an opaque authentication token that identifies the sharing invitation.

example.para: The following code example shows you how to get an opaque authentication token that identifies a sharing invitation. In this example, user1@contoso.com wants to share its contacts folder with user1@fabikam.com and user2@test.com. IdOfContactsFolder represents the object that corresponds to the contacts folder of user1@contoso.com.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::FolderIdType ^ IdOfFolderToShare { ExchangeWebServices::FolderIdType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::FolderIdType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an object that identifies the folder to share.
Docs.value: The value of the property is a that identifies the folder to share.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <System::String ^> ^ Recipients { cli::array <System::String ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <System::String ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a string that contains the SMTP e-mail addresses of one or more entities that will be invited to share data in the folder that is specified by the property.
Docs.value: The value of the property is a string that contains SMTP e-mail addresses.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SenderSmtpAddress { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the SMTP e-mail address that corresponds to the mailbox that contains the folder that is identified by the property.
Docs.value: The value of the property is a string that contains an SMTP e-mail address.
